key_insight: AnyAD introduces a single unified anomaly-detection model that handles any subset of available MRI sequences at inference time (including unseen combinations) without retraining, by learning a modality-agnostic latent representation and cross-modal reconstruction.
problem_solved: Clinical brain MRI often has missing or variable combinations of sequences, and prior AD models require fixed modality inputs or repeated training for different combinations; AnyAD solves scalable anomaly detection across incomplete multi-sequence MRI data.
method: Train a single modality-agnostic encoderâ€“decoder with a shared latent space so any subset of sequences can be encoded and used for reconstruction or cross-modal synthesis.
Use random modality masking/dropout during training to simulate incomplete inputs and force the model to generalize to unseen modality combinations.
Compute anomaly scores from reconstruction discrepancies and uncertainty estimates in the shared latent/reconstruction space to detect abnormal regions robustly.
impact: Provides a practical, deployable AD solution for real-world MRI workflows where sequences are frequently missing, reducing the need for multiple specialized models and enabling consistent anomaly screening across variable clinical inputs.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: flexible input of any combination of MRI sequences into a single encoder, shared latent space, and cross-modal decoder.
Illustration of modality dropout during training (icons for T1/T2/FLAIR with random masking) to show robustness to missing data.
Example MRI slices with overlayed anomaly heatmaps from the model vs. ground truth to show detection quality.
Bar/line chart comparing performance (AUC or detection rate) across different modality combinations and against single-modality baselines.
paper_title: AnyAD: Unified Any-Modality Anomaly Detection in Incomplete Multi-Sequence MRI
paper_authors: Changwei Wu, Yifei Chen, Yuxin Du, Mingxuan Liu, Jinying Zong
